thread.title: Former Harrisburg Mayor Booted from Parole Board
thread.title_full: Former Harrisburg Mayor Booted from Parole Board

title: Former Harrisburg Mayor Booted from Parole Board
text:
Former Harrisburg Mayor Booted from Parole Board   Oct 4, 2015 at 2:38   Oct 4, 2015 at 6:04 PM CDT 
WSIL -- The man credited with getting Harrisburg through the aftermath of the Leap Day Tornado of 2012 has lost his state job. 
Gov. Rauner removed former Harrisburg mayor Eric Gregg from the Illinois Prisoner Review Board on Friday over allegations that Gregg made improper outside income. Those serving on the state parole board are not allowed to have outside jobs. 
Gregg tells News 3 it's simply a misunderstanding resulting from an error by his attorney. Gregg says the attorney mistakenly put $45,000 in income under his name rather than his wife's name on a bankruptcy document. 
Both Rauner and Gregg are Republicans. But party affiliation did not help his cause. Gregg tells News 3 the Rauner administration offered to let him resign. However, he says, he refused to resign on principle. He's also considering legal action against the state. 
Gregg promises to sit down with News 3 on Monday afternoon for a one-on-one interview in which he says he'll provide documents proving he did nothing wrong.
